results.title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
results.creator_credit: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services
results.brief_description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services

results.title: The Birders
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Winner of the 1976 Australian National Travel Association Jedda Award at the Australian Film Awards. The mutton bird industry of the Furneaux Islands (Cape Barren Island and Flinders Island) in Bass Strait is a little known and historic primary industry started by sealers more than 150 years ago. The film records the rugged life style of the small band of people involved in Mutton birding. Narrated by Ross Thompson and photographed by Kevin Anderson. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Morgan, John Richardson, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Kestrel Films (Australia)

results.title: Towards Baruya manhood. Part 2. Village life II
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Village life of the Baruya tribe in the Eastern Highlands of New Guinea. Includes work on a new garden, making a scarecrow, a cassowary hunters’ dance, part of a healing ceremony, and women feeding their pigs.

results.title: Towards Baruya manhood. Part 1. Village life I
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The first of a series of nine films about Baruya village life, social organisation, and agriculture. The Baruya belong to the Anga group of tribes of the Eastern Highlands of New Guinea.

results.title: The Black pirate. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited and narrated presentation of the duels, sea battles and acrobatics in the ‘Black Pirate’ an adventure film made in 1926 starring Douglas Fairbanks. Includes the famous sliding-down-the-sail stunt. Also stars Billie Dove.

results.title: Senses and perception: links to the outside world
results.creator_credit: Giancarlo Lui, Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Shows differences in the process of sensory perception in higher animals and man. Emphasises that the senses are an animal’s link to its environment and are necessary for its survival.
Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Big yellow taxi
results.creator_credit: John Wilson and Fine Art Productions
results.brief_description: Joni Mitchell sings to an animated interpretation of her lyrics in this film with a clear environmental warning. Adam and Eve’s paradise is invaded by powerful road-making machinery that proceeds to tear down the vegetation and cover the earth with tar and cement.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: attitudes
results.brief_description: One of a group of films about sex role stereotyping in schools. Examines the response of students and teachers to a female principal, and her own attitudes to her position. No other credits available.

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Koenigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a clearly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
